attributes.action: Change the law for mothers who separate and are not married
attributes.background: The law should be changed so that women who separate from a long term relationship have the right to a fair settlement of their finances and living arrangements. It’s not right that someone can be in a relationship for 15 years, have children together and have no rights.

attributes.action: Save Britain's Motorways from terrible driving with regular reminders.
attributes.background: Britain's Motorways are congested, but this isn't helped by terrible drivers. Slow driving and lane hogging can be worse than speeding. Speeding is policed with signs and fines. Do the same and regularly remind drivers on digital displays and bridges to speed up or keep left. Simple but effective.
attributes.additional_details:
https://metro.co.uk/2018/12/29/crashes-caused-drivers-going-slow-soar-third-8290610/

Personal experience of driving on Britain's roads.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Code of Conduct for Members of Parliament to be amended.
attributes.background: No MP, their immediate family partners or spouses may hold any offshore account exempt from UK Income Tax in order to ensure integrity in Office.
attributes.additional_details:
The Armed Forces of the United Kingdom abide by the Codes of Conduct that are integral to the maintenance and the upholding of the highest moral standards so as to be beyond reproach in their actions.  It is proposed that transparency, honesty, courage and discipline be returned to the Houses of Parliament.  
https://www.army.mod.uk/media/5219/20180910-values_standards_2018_final.pdf

attributes.action: Move the British embassy in Israel to Jerusalem
attributes.background: Israel like every country is allowed to make the choice of where its capital is. Israel has chosen its capital as Jerusalem. Therefore the embassy should be in Jerusalem, as most embassies are in countries’ capitals.

attributes.action: Publish Northern Ireland (no border) planning papers in a no-deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has published numerious technical notices for a no-deal Brexit outcome. Information provided covers a wide range of topics, from pet travel requirements to pharmaceuticals. Since EU can't stop the UK from a no-deal Brexit, what are the governments unilateral contingency plans for N.I.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/how-to-prepare-if-the-uk-leaves-the-eu-with-no-deal#overview

attributes.action: Fine for parked car running over 1 minute and let people provide evidence of it.
attributes.background:
My child have born recently I understood there is necessary to do something about unnecessary usage of fuel.
In average city I can't walk a few meters to not smell terrible diesel exhaust. 
So
-no idling the car over 1 minute
-when asked to switch off and ignored video footage could bring a fee.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a new legislation about it but its completely useless to bring somebody to responsibility for this behaviour.
I really don't believe people stop speeding when they could avoid the fine being asked to slow down and obey the request.
Lots of cars make the same pollution(some of the gases) while idling when driving even they use much less fuel. I'm driver and i don't want to stop usage of fuels and cars but save the environment and the wallet when possible to make our place to live better

attributes.action: Change smoking warnings to include the benefits of stopping smoking
attributes.background: Smoking warnings are scare stories that may impact people but they are all one sided and only convey the negative aspects of smoking. Why not include the positive aspects of stopping smoking. Short texts documenting the benefits along with the negative could work better than the usual scare stories.
attributes.additional_details:
On the NHS website the first lines on the what happens when you stop smoking page are - Stopping smoking can make a drastic improvement to your lifestyle and health in ways you might not expect. 
And 
Once you stop smoking, some of the benefits are immediate and some are longer-term.
They then include personal stories of people who quit smoking. The question is which approach works better? The warnings or the benefits? Or even a mix of both? It seems that the one sided approach is naive at best.

attributes.action: Amend rail franchises so fares cannot be increased until trains are 90% on time
attributes.background: The current train operator of South west trains are so bad. The service is worst than the operator that was there before. Now they are increasing the rail fares when the service is so bad (trains are either delayed or cancelled).

attributes.action: I’m asking for mindfulness and self love taught compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: The mental health and crime rates are at a controllable level if you actively put in place the right solution. Mindfulness meditation and self love and appreciation of others should be taught compulsory in schools as this could mean the difference for our next generation. This can only be positive.
attributes.additional_details: We are moving in to a time where children are struggling with self love, love of others and the ability to handle emotions, not being able to handle emotions results in dissociating with them, this is why most children and adult are currently suffering. We need to teach children how to love one another for internal attributes and ensure meditation in the morning so they are ready for their day. Children work harder than we think and deserve the right care, they rest their bodies what about minds

attributes.action: Remove free bus travel from under 16s
attributes.background: Child obesity is big concern in this day & age. By removing free travel, more children would walk to school instead of jumping on bus for just one or two stops!
attributes.additional_details: Removal of children's free travel will not only help obesity, but also cut congestion on buses, where people going to work & the elderly could get a seat

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: On average tuition fees cost up to £9,250 a year. People CANT AFFORD this!

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for those working between 9pm and 7am to £14 p/h
attributes.background: Workers of late shifts—which have been proven to have detrimental effects on health—are increasingly common, and these workers are being exploited.
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco—who made a £1·6bl profit last quarter—pay staff near minimum wage to work until midnight. Clubs hire 18–21-year-olds at £5.60/h till 5.The real living wage in the U.K. is nearly £10/h: https://bbc.in/2JGrY0b This work is unhealthy and those employed deserve compensation.

Study noting an increase in the risk of an early death amongst night-shift workers: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/28/night-shift-three-million-workers-health-risks-obesity-cancer-diabetes

Radio 4 on damage to organs and the brain caused by nightwork: https://www.ajpmonline.org/article/S0749-3797(14)00623-0/fulltext

https://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/news/how-can-working-night-shifts-affect-mental-and-physical-health

attributes.action: Make standard code of practice for safety in soft play & indoor play mandatory
attributes.background: As a parent of 3 children,I know just how popular soft play centres can be for families. With UK weather, they are often needed as fair weather place for children to play. Just as the amount of centres in the UK increase, so do the amount of incidents including harm to children. Regulation is needed
attributes.additional_details:
There are many cases that have been reported in the news of incidents at soft play, which include:
Accidents:
https://www.netmums.com/coffeehouse/being-mum-794/children-4-11-years-60/759544-soft-play-centres-accidents.html
Bullying & Harm:
https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/whats-on/family-kids/mum-bullied-abused-playcentre-having-2029547
Food Hygeine
https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/investigation-play-factory-vomiting-outbreak-14443979

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Make domestic abuse punishments more severe.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 children in the UK have witnessed domestic abuse, this can psychologically torment and haunt these young, innocent, minds. With more support from the government we could make the punishment more severe to make people thing twice before they partake in this disgusting crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 46% of domestic abuse crimes ended in arrests in 2007 which deters others from reporting the abuse.
70% of all domestic abuse stories are female.
On average an individual will have been abused 35 times before reporting.
Domestic abuse costs the public £23 billion each year.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Send out regular SMS/email updates for people on Mental Health waiting lists
attributes.background:
The NHS should ensure a mandatory "keep customer informed" system is implemented for mental health care in the UK. This would provide patients on Mental Health team waiting lists with updates on how it is until their case is to be progressed.
 
I believe this is crucial for patient self-esteem.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently on a waiting list for the NHS Mental Health team and have been since June 2018. This team would give me an evaluation, handing me on to the correct team, as appropriate. Previously, I have been referred to other services - I cannot go back to them, as they have said I need an evaluation from the Mental Health team first. However, this also means that I have not updated by anyone. I feel I should know that my case is being progressed, and how soon it will be.

attributes.action: To be exempt from paying council tax when you reach government retirement age.
attributes.background:
Once you retire you are no longer bringing in a working income. 
You have to live on your pension and saving's (If you have any saving's) These have to last you untill you die. Which can be many years from the government retirement age ( Hopefully).
attributes.additional_details:
Many elderly end in poverty and struggle to have all of there basic needs met,due to such bills and not enough money for living costs. 
Many have paid towards society in all the years of there working life.  
So why should they be expected to pay such a significant amount to society when they are not getting a working income.

attributes.action: Reduce Drink Drive Limit to zero
attributes.background:
Hundreds of people are killed every year as a result of drink driving. 

Why do we allow people to drink and drive???

Stop all drink driving and stop unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
Department Of Transport
Last updated 14 February 2019.

Final estimates of casualties in accidents due to drink-drive limit for 2016.

Between 220 and 250 people were killed in drink drive accidents, with a estimate of 230 fatalities since 2015. Continuing a period of stability recorded since 2010 an estimated 9,040 people were killed or injured in drink-drive accidents, a rise of 7% since 2015 the total number of drink-drive accidents rose by 6% to 6,070 in 2016.

attributes.action: Abolish ability grouping in all primary schools
attributes.background:
Ability grouping is practiced across English primary education. 
A study conducted by the OECD concluded: “countries which stream pupils into ability groups at an early age tend to have lower levels of achievement". We want better education for our children in Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
A study conducted by the OECD concluded: “countries which stream pupils into ability groups at an early age tend to have lower levels of achievement". We want better education for our children in Britain.
 
Beatriz Pont, an education analyst and one of the authors of the OECD's study, said "streaming by ability at an early age "fuelled a vicious cycle" in which teachers had low expectations of students in the lowest sets. These students were often "locked into a lower educational environment before they had a chance to develop … their potential.”
To view the study: http://www.oecd.org/education/school/equityandqualityineducation-supportingdisadvantagedstudentsandschools.htm

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all vehicles to be fitted with a dash cam
attributes.background: Too many people are killed or seriously injured on UK roads.  Around 95% of incidents are caused by human error; what a driver does or fails to do.  Cameras would make drivers more responsible for their actions and save a lot of time investigating incidents.  Dashcam evidence could be conclusive

attributes.action: Remove the minimum income floor for the self employed, equal rights.
attributes.background: The self employed people of this country work hard doing what they chose focus their skills on. It’s good for growth, it’s good for the economy. So forcing self employed people back onto job seekers allowance when they can earn most of their living themselves is counter intuitive. Make work pay?!

attributes.action: Change autism spectrum disorder to autism spectrum condition on gov. publication
attributes.background: I personally have Asperger’s syndrome and do not see it as a disorder and the word disorder sheds a bad light on autism while the word condition gives it less negative connotations. Many people with autism are very talented and should not be defined as having a disorder.
attributes.additional_details: Websites such as the NHS use ASD. All official publications should use “condition” instead.

attributes.action: Ban smoking while walking on pavements of UK towns and cities.
attributes.background: Smoke-free walkways and public places legislation has been introduced in many countries to protect the public from the harmful effects of secondhand smoking.

attributes.action: Abolish indefinite detention of immigrants by implementing a 1 month limit.
attributes.background:
We have a policy of keeping some immigrants in indefinite detention.  This is unjust as:
A. It can cause mental distress because of uncertainty, immigrants can be kept for longer than 1 year.
B. It can allow inefficiency in processing immigrants.
C. Some detained came to the UK as minors.
attributes.additional_details:
Report of a detention centre
https://www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk/hmiprisons/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2017/11/Yarls-Wood-Web-2017.pdf

'Nearly half of the detainees said they felt unsafe, and on further enquiry it transpired that this was largely an expression of concern as a result of uncertainty about the future and the prospect of
removal from the UK. '
'In several cases, detention was maintained despite the acceptance of professional evidence of torture.'
'Recommendation: There should be a strict time limit on the length of detention'

Cross-Parliamentary report
https://detentioninquiry.files.wordpress.com/2015/03/immigration-detention-inquiry-report.pdf

'There should be a time limit of 28 days on the length of time anyone can be held in immigration detention'

attributes.action: Support a Referendum to abolish compulsory BBC licence fee
attributes.background: In this age of fair competition the BBC should not be able to unfairly demand a yearly licence payment from the general public without giving the people the choice of having or not having the BBC channels, this is an outdated and unfair monopoly.
attributes.additional_details:
No other media company gets a compulsory payment from the uk general public.
You can choose to have Virgin,Sky etc You have no choice when it comes to the BBC

attributes.action: ABOLISH VAT ON ALL FOOD AND DRINK
attributes.background:
Did you know that in this day and age with food banks in existence the government still collect VAT on basic foods like:

Potato crisps
Biscuits
Ice cream
Chocolate bars
Mineral water
Fizzy drinks
Alcohol free beer and wine
Fruit squash
attributes.additional_details:
This isn’t a time to get all judgemental on whether these food and drinks are unhealthy or not.  People are starving because they can’t afford to eat!

Knocking VAT off the selling price mean that the cost of basic food and drink items could be:

6p for a pack of crisps
1p for a biscuit
10p for a choc ice
2p for 250ml of fizzy drink

Make these high calorie per pence foods more available to reduce malnutrition.  Make your food shopping budget go further.

attributes.action: Give every house free solar panels so we can burn less fossil fuels
attributes.background: If every house gets a solar panel for free they will stop buying electricity and use the free electricity coming from the panel. This can help the environment and reduce climate change

attributes.action: Automatic enrolment on the Organ Donor Register.
attributes.background: People living here should not have to opt in to be an organ donor. They should be on it automatically and have to apply to be removed.
attributes.additional_details: I understand that a small minority of people cannot donate due to medical conditions; There should be automatic removal when the condition is detected.

attributes.action: Allow objectors to appeal a planning approval decisions
attributes.background: If a local authority refuses a planning application, the applicant has the opportunity to appeal the refusal decision in which case the application is passed to the planning inspectorate for review the actions of the local authority. If the application is approved, no right of appeal exists.
attributes.additional_details: Localism allows Local Authorities to make decisions on planning applications at a local level. Applications are often approved against the advice of consultees, objectors and Parish Councils. In the case of approved applications, no similar appeal process is available to objectors. Only an extremely costly Judicial Review is available to challenge the decision and have it reviewed against local and national planning policy by a body outside of the Local Authority. This situation needs to change.

attributes.action: Force employers to show salary and benefits on all advertised jobs
attributes.background:
All too often jobseekers find a job they would like to apply for, they apply, attend interview, receive a job offer and then are frustrated with a disappointing salary and benefits package.
Legislation should be introduced that will see all employers having to advertise the full benefits package.

attributes.action: Increase funding for ambulances so they reach people in time, every time.
attributes.background: The fact is that the ambulance service is under increasing strain. Ambulance staff are working incredibly hard with inadequate funding. This is not acceptable. Sign this petition to force the government to debate this issue that affects everyone.

attributes.action: Start school at 9am and finish at 5pm to introduce children to the working world
attributes.background: Some believe that children and teenagers should be afforded the luxury of starting school at 10am. School hours should reflect the working world instead.

attributes.action: Review and amend the Mental Health Act 1983.
attributes.background: As someone who has had a range of mental health conditions, I'm taking it upon myself to get legislation updated in line with today’s requirements and to ensure other victims are supported.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly, the Mental Health Act 1983 is a piece of legislation from nearly 36 years ago. Awareness, understanding and support has changed vastly in those years, so it's about time legislation did too. 
 
Secondly, some of the content of the act is simply degrading for victims and sufferers of this condition and other conditions similar to it. There are mentions in the Act to detain individuals experiencing or who have experienced an episode for 6 months. As matter of fact, this makes victims worse.

attributes.action: Add Height and Weight as Protected Characteristics to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Height and weight discrimination are not even implemented under The Equality Act 2010, which is meant to be a law for everyone so that it "legally protects people from discrimination in the workplace and in wider society”, Gov.uk.
attributes.additional_details: Important protected characteristics such as age, race and sexual orientation, (all things that cannot be controlled), are included yet height and weight, (some medical conditions mean weight cannot be controlled, such as an underactive thyroid and Cushing's syndrome, NHS.uk), are ignored by our government. Is it fair that only some members of society are legally protected from being discriminated against?

attributes.action: Promise to rebate all tariffs imposed by EU on UK exports.
attributes.background: Because the balance of trade with the EU is massively in UK favour, we could rebate every penny paid in export taxes on goods going to EU. By doing this there would be zero effect on cost of UK goods in the EU because any export tariffs will be refunded.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the House of Commons library statistics 30th Nov 2018: 
 
UK exports to EU = £274 billion 
UK imports from the EU = £341 billion 
Assume a nominal tariff of 11% both ways: 
£274B * 0.11 = £30B 
£341B * 0.11 = £37.5B 
Therefore if we rebate the £30 Billion to UK manufacturing, we would make a profit of £7.5 Billion. There’s a few hospitals right there!

attributes.action: London workers living outside its boundary should vote in Mayoral elections.
attributes.background: London workers spend days each week providing labour, skills and expertise in our capital. Many businesses would fail without this army of commuters adding to London's economy. Having made this contribution, they have no vote when it comes to choosing its Mayor.

attributes.action: All asylum seekers crossing the Channel be given the right to live in the UK
attributes.background: The UK has a proud history of tolerance, compassion and respect for human rights. Action must be taken to prevent a potential tragedy in the Channel. If asylum seekers are returned to France or elsewhere, they will simply try again to get to the UK. The problem will escalate unless stopped.
attributes.additional_details: If refugees attempt to cross the Channel by dinghy to get to the UK, then they should be intercepted, brought safely to the UK shore and automatically granted the right to live in the UK on humanitarian grounds. Once in the UK, all refugees and asylum seekers must be given the right to settle and be treated with dignity and respect. They must have provision to live in the community. There must be no use of immigration detention centres - fleeing war, genocide and persecution is not a crime.

attributes.action: Outlaw service charges on bar/restaurant bills
attributes.background: It should be illegal for bars and restaurants to add extra charges on to bills. The cost of a meal should be included in the price on the menu. Staff should not have to rely on tips to get a living wage, but should be paid properly.
attributes.additional_details: Customers should not feel obliged at the end of a meal to pay for what can feel like an extra meal price. In addition, the service provided by restaurants is not always justifiable to warrant paying a service charge.

attributes.action: Raise the practical driving test standards considerably.
attributes.background: By raising the Practical Driving Test Standards we can expect to see only the safest drivers pass and the road fatalities fall. If the standards are raised considerably everyone including young drivers will enjoy a lower insurance premium and safer roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The average cost for a young driver under the age of 25 to obtain an insurance in 2018 is a whopping £1400!

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/insurance/young-drivers/

Young drivers account for a quarter of road fatalities.

https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/448039/young-car-drivers-2013-data.pdf

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Give under 18's free self-test STI kits
attributes.background: Self-test kits for STIs are also available online and on the high street. They include home testing kits for infections such as chlamydia and gonorrhoea that you can send away to a laboratory. This could be a huge help to the amount of people who are nervous or shy to go to such clinic to be tested.

attributes.action: Make it a UK law for premises selling food or drink to hold EpiPens
attributes.background: Allergies are on the rise in the UK and there are an increasing amount of stories of people who have suffered severely or even died from the unawareness and ignorance surrounding food allergies. Many cases of anaphylaxis could be prevented if epipens were provided by food and drink establishments
attributes.additional_details: There have been many cases where a second EpiPen has been needed to treat an anaphylaxis shock. If food establishments were to hold EpiPens for consumers with allergies they could prevent serious illness and in some cases death. It is understandable that EpiPens can't just be handed out to any member of the public so I propose that allergy sufferers carry a card with them, provided by the NHS to state that they have a serious allergy and can be administered with an EpiPen.
